bill_title: require certain information regarding the use of cellular telephones in motor vehicles involved in traffic accidents to be compiled, evaluated, and reported.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require certain information regarding the use of cellular telephones in motor vehicles involved in traffic accidents to be compiled, evaluated, and reported. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Beginning with the report to be made in 2005, the secretary of the Department of Public Safety shall include in the annual South Dakota Motor Vehicle Traffic Accident Summary, information relative to whether the use of a cellular telephone or other communication device by the operator of a motor vehicle contributed to, or was a factor in, any accident reported pursuant to § 32-34-10. Section 2. The secretary of the Department of Public Safety, the director of the Office of Highway Safety, and the director of the Division of Insurance shall: (1) Collect and evaluate statistics, as compiled pursuant to § 32-34-10 and as required pursuant to section 1 of this Act, showing whether the use of cellular telephones has increased the incidence of accidents or accidents per mile of similar motor vehicles; and (2) Evaluate whether the use, nonuse, or extent of use of cellular telephones by motorists should be proposed as a factor in determining: (a) Lower premium rates of motor vehicle insurance policies, if appropriate; (b) Tort liability in motor vehicle accident law suits; (c) Safety instructions given to customers by sellers, installers, and lessors of cellular telephones; and (d) Any other safety proposal on the use of cellular telephones. Section 3. In implementing section 2 of this Act, the secretary of the Department of Public Safety, the director of the Office of Highway Safety, and the Director of the Division of Insurance shall consult with each other, representatives of the motor vehicle insurance industry, the cellular telephone industry, consumer and safety groups, and such other persons with expertise they deem relevant. The secretary of the Department of Public Safety shall report the group's findings, including legislative proposals, to the Governor and Legislature prior to January 15, 2005.
